review_blob: Cloudy Orange-ish with a one finger white head. Good lacing already. Wonderful sweet aroma......sweet fruit, pine and grass. Incredible flavor and think mouth feel for such a light IPA. Awesome.

aaalot of carbination........not a super thick pour either. great aroma of roasted malts and such. same with the flavor. I thought this was gonna be a bigger beer...but thats not a bad thing, its quite drinkable and in a very good way.
deep brown thick pour, with a small but gorgeous head. aroma of brown sugar, sweet dark fruits. much of the same with the flavor and very slight alcohol at the end but wonderful.
beer_name: Dieu du Ciel Rigor Mortis Abt

review_blob: deep muddy color. Not much of an aroma....much better taste, chocolate, coffee and a touch of creaminess. only drawback is the slight alcohol at the end but very drinkable at 7.5
deep color.......good pour.....very floral aroma. i thought it was well balanced.
beer_name: Samuel Adams LongShot Honey Bs Lavender Ale

review_blob: I was surprised that this was listed as an IPA! More along the lines of an APA to me. lightest IPA ever.....but very good...APA/IPA hybrid maybe.

Deep amber pour with a decent light tan head.....lots of caramel and pine needles. It smells like a palate bruiser. Really big IPA......bitter bitter.....but good. better as it sits for a bit. ooooooo this is tasty.the alcohol is well hidden.very well balanced, but still slightly leans to the malt.
this is stock. normal stout pour.......not near the carbination of guinness. creamy coconut flavor mixed with really strong/slightly sour coffee. Fair.

hazy gpld pour with a small, white, frothy head. bright grassy aroma. very crisp hoppy and unusual finish. slightly sweet.....one of the brightest beers i have ever tasted....slightly acidic lotsa lemon and grapefruit finish. nice thick mouthfeel....great.

hazy golden pour with a slight small head.......not much of an aroma.....but this is very tasty! i had it the other day over at the bronx deli and i was surprised. very refreshing nice bright floral taste. not much of a finish either but a wick session beer.
Very nice deep pour and thick for a pale ale......awesome deep color with a gnarley head.....wooooooo bright and bitter!!! lovely grass and grapefruit taste.....very quaffable! Cheers

A freind of mine was gracious enough to drop one of these off to me by surprise the other day! pumped to try this! Nice amber/orange pour, not much of a head but looks pretty thick. Really thick feel....but the flavor is very sublte as well. hints of all the usual IPA stuff but wifh an almost juice like character to it.......very easy to drink....the alcohol is very sublte as well. very good
huge black  pour into a snifter...strong coffee and dark fruit aromas. Definately a gigantic beer. very tasty and thick.....very good...thanks to a freind for hooking me up with this!

Pours very dark..darker than I expected for some reason. Different aroma for sure, but good. Almost like PB&J; I guess. The fruit stout mixes have become kinda trendy lately. Really a good mouth feel. Flavor is sour jelly on a burnt piece of toast....kinda funky like a sour or farm house ale. A little daring......shorts is great for that, not always the best, but always fun to drink.

I love this beer. Not much in the aroma and looks department. But such an easy drinking brew. If u like DFH Festina Peche then u will love this. Very similar but with out the peach flavor. Great change of pace!!!
I am never disappointed by Sam. Very zesty and bright. Very easy to drink. This would be great with a lemon slice...even though very few beers can pull that off.
well what can you say about this.......good?......or bad?......not anything that hasnt been said already.
nice deep brown por wtih a small tan head. Sweet aroma of nuts....hazel.....and toffee.....the flavor is alot tof the same with a nice a slow mouthfeel. Great.
absolute water.........cereal aroma. Pale golden color, water on the palate.....pound these all night and still not be griggy in the morning

Bottle at the Union, in a snifter. Nice slow pour with a good white head of medium size. Aroma is outragious.....tangerines, citus slightly grassy with hints of pine. massive hop flavor...ABV is 9....not as strong as hopslam but stronger than two hearted....amazing stuff....I hope this stuff becomes commonplace. Cuase it is spectacular.

has the aroma of a really malty macro. nice copper appearance with ligh carbination Good lacing as well. very malty with a nutty peanut finish. Very thin mouth feel but easy to drink....Bells is most likely my favorite brewer and i look forward to this every year......pround to have it as my 200th

Fruit and yest with a touch of sweetness. Hazy golden yellow pur with a small white head. Very big yeast and ripe fruits flavor and carbination and zip on the tounge. Finishes nice with a little warming on he palate.Very good beer. Unibroue always a
 has a distinct Flavor....They take a style and makinf thier own. Not thier best but better than most.

black por with a huge dark brown head....nice dark fruit aroma....smells real similar to Guinness. But the flavor is huge and very complex....tons of roasted malts...super bitter. And the ever present JP funk...and some sourness. the palate is kinda watery but the coffee bitterness mix with the sourness is there as well. very unique offering from JP as usual.
ooooooooo.....this looks nice. golden copper color...with a small white head. very mild flavor and finish clean great summer beer.
beer_name: Black Sheep Monty Pythons Holy Grail (Bottle)

review_blob: 2005 bottle......very nice pour....hazy orange pour with a huge fluffy white head. nice mildew, dirt and old house funk to it.  maybe cause its such an old bottle but it is vey mild....wow.....slight funk to it like you would expect also, a touch of pepper and spice. this is awesome ....very mild. wonderful
Black por with a nice tan head......roasted note in the aroma and a very deep and rich malt flavor. Creamy and very, very drinkable.....unbeliveable. So good and finishes soooo clean. WOW

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: golden yellow pour......I thought this would be more of a wheat style apperance but.....macro gold it is.....belgian yeast and a slight sweetness to it. Very easy to drink and a slightly soapy finnish. ( and yes it wasnt the glass) not bad.
beer_name: Magic Hat Odd Notion - Belgian Blonde (Summer 09)

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: I like this a shit-ton!!!!! nice orange pour, very mild grassy sweey notes and the flavor is very subtle for an IPA as well. Orange, citrus pine and grass. very easy drinking zIPA i like it alot. great summer beer!

Dirty orange pour wih lots of carbanation and a big cream colored head that disapated quickly. U can definately smell the ginger and belgian yeast. the flavor is much of the same with an unusual bite....almost sour but not in a saison funky sour more like a medicinal bitting sour. this is definately one of the more unusual beers  have ever had.

Very nice color! beautiful red pour though not much head and almost no aroma.....maybe be a very light sweetness? The flavor is cool though....very light and grainey with a huge fresh michigan cherries. with just a touch of brown sugar. That it it tastes like cherry pie!!!!! just like it in fact very good.

Black pour with a small fawn colored head, Roasty aroma. Lots of malts and chocolate. tHFLAVOR IS MUCH OF THE SAME WITH HINTS OF LICORICE AND COFFEE. sLIGHLY FUNKY TASTING. iM NOT TOO SURE ABOUT THIS BOTTLE. I  am usually all about anything by bells. This dosent even come close to the kalamazzoo stout which is incredible.

this is such an unusual pour.....and not in a bad way either. Thick pour for an IPA. Descent head and great lacing. Man this thing has legs for an IPA. Deeeeeeeep orange color. Sweet aroma of sweet apricots and sugar, DUH. Wow! Jusy so different sweet sour and bitter all the same. Almost has a dirty sock flavor. The ever present ceader wood DFH finish as well. Another unique brew from DFH.

Clear straw gold pour with a light fizzy head. lots of corn and grain aroma and a touch of medicinal. Same witht the flavor. But, it sits so well on the palate, I dont mean its extraordinary. but satisfying. nice clean finish. very good for what it is.

Very pedestrian for a hefe. not as cloudy or aromatic as one would think. Slight cloves and malts on the flavor and aroma.but a nice crispness to it and very drinkable. you can never knock sam adams for tying tto bring different styles to the average beer drinker and i applaude them for that.

Straw gold pour with a good size head. Nice grassy aroma. WoW! nice hop kick that is not too over powering......very drinkable. much lighter than I was expecting. This is a definate winner. It finishes very clean and crisp.
What a beer! Amber pour with a generous white head. and definate grain and barley aroma. Heavy malt flavor as well. but you know it runs circles around most other lagers. just like regular Sam.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Its pink!?!?! with a moderate  white/pink head. Grain and grassy aroma.  Smells alot like the #9. The flavor is a touch grainy as well but it does have a little hop bite. over all a very enjoyable beer. I cant get over the color!!! really its almost hot pink. ha ha ha very unique.

Brown pour and lots of carbination.......Slightly roasted aroma. This is the second or third time Ive had an Arcadia brew that was wayyyy to carbonated for my taste. And a touch of medicinal mixed witht the roasted and nutty flavors. OK. not outstanding.

Finally.....I had to wait this long for a beer in my own state?!?!?! well the time has come. Huge aroma of what elase.....Raspberries and caramel. Awesome deeeeeeeeeep red/mahogany color. no head with slight lacing arona the edges. The Flavor is outta this world! Huge Caramale and the raspberry only slightly come through. The caaramel is outrageous. The alcohol rears it head initally but fade quickly. The finish is off the charts.......this is were the chocolate intertwines with the caramel and a trace of raspberry let you know what you are drinking. Is it worth the price for the little bottle....i dont know but I will see if I can get a few more bottles. And they would never come out except the best and most rare occasions. ubeliveable.
Golden/slightly hazy pour.....with good lacing. Nice aroma slight citrus and grass......and unfortunately some card board. The flavor is crisp. clean hoppy and bitter. Awesome!!!!!!!
beer_name: Flying Dog Tire Bite Golden Ale

review_blob: Black por with a slight tan head. not a very big aroma. Roated malts and that aabout it........the usual cofffee and roasted malt flavors. This is scary drinkable. I likes all though I am a tad disappointed.

Very nice red pour with a small off white head. Aroma of yeast and malts. very warm.  Great flavor off caramel, toffee and a hint of chocolate. Slightly sweet and a clean finish. the more I have from this brewer the more I become a fan.
Very nice copper cloudy pour with a slightly sweet and macro aroma. Flavor is citrus and caramel candies. Very smooth This is great it strikes my fancy for sure.
I agree with the guy who said it is better than miller lite. a really bad version of bud light. not undrinkable though.

This is one big Son-of-a-bitch. Big pour with the color of a dead leaf in the fall. ginormus swett aroma of sugar, vanilla, coconut and dark fruits.  lots of sediment with a nice one finger off white head. holy hell it burnsgoing  down....not in a bad way though....and the taste is alot of the same as the aroma, but the roasted malts tend to come out at the end. the finish is very long hops, malts and coffee all peek thier head out on a long finish. solid pour for sure.
Malts and spices.....amber color with alot of head. Ginger and spices. Decent brew. intro to craft beer.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Goldenslightly orange pour with a slight white head and very carbonated. Nice lemon cirtus and malt aroma......same with the flavor. A touch of sweetness and bitter hop at the end. Very smooth finish as well. This is a very solid aand well done beer.

Big black pour with a almost non-exsistant tan head. The aroma is huge caramel and malt.....almost like a barley wine. The flavor is very sweet....caramel, roasted malts.....dark fruits and a coffe finish. The mouthfeel is outtta this world.....it so velvety smooth and coats the tounge. sold pour.
beer_name: Samuel Adams Imperial Series Imperial Stout

review_blob: Golden/orange pour with a small head and not much of an aroma....maybe a slight sweetnesss to it and that is about it. Wonderful flavor though. Touch of sweet fruit up fromt.....but then a wood and smokey flavor. Very quaffable and enjoyable. I likes.
beer_name: Flying Dog Garde Dog Bire de Garde

review_blob: I preffer this to the normal blue. Neither are spectacular....but bith get to drink. normal macro offering all the usual. Atributes. Straw/Corn color, taste, mouthfeel and finish. never lets me down.
